data.title: For All The Dogs
data.description: Несмотря на то, что Дриззи является одним из самых популярных артистов современно музыкальной сцены, он не останавливается на достигнутом и постоянно напоминает о себе различными инфоповодами. Находясь в разгаре масштабного тура «It's All A Blur», канадский хитмейкер успел анонсировать и несколько раз перенести свою новую студийную пластинку, которая наконец увидела свет. После «Honestly, Nevermind» (https://t.me/fastfoodmusictg/8929), который был воспринят публикой довольно противоречиво, Дрейк решил отказаться от экспериментов и вернуться к звучанию, за которое его полюбили изначально. Зыбкая атмосфера Торонто в совокупности с проникновенной лирикой и цепляющими хуками, будь то трэп- или R&B-композиция, вернулись на «FOR ALL THE DOGS».

data.title: To Pimp A Butterfly
data.description: Categorized by Billboard as a politically-charged conscious rap album,[38] To Pimp a Butterfly explores a variety of political and personal themes related to race, culture, and discrimination. Critic Neil Kulkarni said it appraises the broken promises and bloody pathways in and out of America's heartland malaise.[39] Jay Caspian Kang observed elements of critical race theory, respectability politics, theology, and meta-analysis examining Lamar's success and revered status in the hip hop community.[40] It was compared by California State University, Fullerton professor Natalie Graham to the 1977 television miniseries Roots. While Roots compresses and simplifies black history, Graham said To Pimp a Butterfly radically disrupt[s] meanings of black respectability, heroic morality, trauma, and memory.[41] In the Toronto Journal of Theology, James D. McLeod Jr. drew parallels between Lamar's examination of death's domineering significance in the African-American experience and the works of Christian theologian Paul Tillich, with McLeod calling To Pimp a Butterfly an original example of existentialist hip hop.[42] Meanwhile, Adam Blum discerned connections between To Pimp a Butterfly and the writings of psychoanalysts such as Wilfred Bion, Nicolas Abraham, and Sigmund Freud.[43] In an essay published in The Lancet Psychiatry, University of Cambridge professors Akeem Sule and Becky Inkster described Lamar as the street poet of mental health, noting how To Pimp a Butterfly (as well as its predecessor, Good Kid, M.A.A.D City) explore topics such as addiction, anxiety, depression, and resilience.[44]

data.title: TESTING
data.description: TESTING is the third studio album by Harlem rapper, A$AP Rocky, following his last album AT.LONG.LAST.A$AP released in 2015. In an interview with GQ, A$AP said that this album is really about experimentation with new sounds: People are scared to test new sounds, so they go with what’s current, ‘cause it’s the easy thing to do. I don’t just rap – I actually make music. That’s why it takes time. These sonics represent me.The album proves to be one of Rocky’s most versatile. Just like its selection of samples, TESTING plays host to a far-reaching list of contributors. The most unexpected guests include FKA twigs and MGMT, who both help to make “Fukk Sleep” the waking-dream of a space-trap cut that it is. Elsewhere, Dev Hynes adds his nostalgic-R&B Blood Orange vibe to “Hund43d.” The album is also extremely personal at times. On “Purity” he raps about losing loved ones in his life, and on “Changes” he ponders on his previous relationships.A range of musical styles and genres have been achieved on this album, truly living up to its title. The album was released on May 25th as well as its credits and its tracklist.

data.title: Bloom
data.description: Beach House’s fourth full length LP and longest work to date is a true masterwork. After the release of their acclaimed Teen Dream (which would eventually be cited as one of the greatest dream pop albums of its time), there was a lot of pressure to make an album worthy of its predecessor.However, they proved they had even more potential to boast with this hazy, extended performance of some of the finest dream pop songs, taking elements from that of the Cocteau Twins.
